title: Best Chiropractor Hollywood Florida
description: Discover the best and top chiropractic and medical wellness services in Hollywood, Florida, at Premier Total Healthcare. Our experienced team offers comprehensive healthcare solutions, including expert chiropractic care, cutting-edge medical treatments, and holistic wellness services. Experience personalized care and achieve total well-being with our state-of-the-art facility. Book an appointment today for a healthier, happier you
cleaned_text: CHIROPRACTIC & MEDICAL FOCUSED ON ALTERNATIVE & PREVENTIVE SOLUTIONS REALIGN YOUR BODY & HEALTH Scroll Down CHIROPRACTIC & MEDICAL SERVICES Even though chiropractic care is one of the most traditional and well-known medical treatments, more and more people in [Hollywood, Florida](https://www.google.com/search?q=premier+total+health+care+hollywood+florida&source=hp&ei=54BCZJilC-e-kPIP3Lm52AU&iflsig=AOEireoAAAAAZEKO98WRJ63oMKvWgA7fSPQaTq3Tocaa&ved=0ahUKEwjYtJ6b_Lr-AhVnH0QIHdxcDlsQ4dUDCAs&uact=5&oq=premier+total+health+care+hollywood+florida&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz#bsht=CgRmYnNtEgQIBDAB) [ and the surrounding South Florida areas, ](https://www.google.com/search?q=premier+total+health+care+hollywood+florida&source=hp&ei=54BCZJilC-e-kPIP3Lm52AU&iflsig=AOEireoAAAAAZEKO98WRJ63oMKvWgA7fSPQaTq3Tocaa&ved=0ahUKEwjYtJ6b_Lr-AhVnH0QIHdxcDlsQ4dUDCAs&uact=5&oq=premier+total+health+care+hollywood+florida&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz#bsht=CgRmYnNtEgQIBDAB)are choosing to visit chiropractors on a daily basis. Because contemporary medical practitioners are beginning to understand that many physical diseases and ailments may be better treated organically and with a holistic approach rather than with prescription medicines, people are turning to chiropractic care. This is one of the reasons more people are searching for ["chiropractor near me"](https://www.google.com/search?q=premier+total+health+care+hollywood+florida&source=hp&ei=54BCZJilC-e-kPIP3Lm52AU&iflsig=AOEireoAAAAAZEKO98WRJ63oMKvWgA7fSPQaTq3Tocaa&ved=0ahUKEwjYtJ6b_Lr-AhVnH0QIHdxcDlsQ4dUDCAs&uact=5&oq=premier+total+health+care+hollywood+florida&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz#bsht=CgRmYnNtEgQIBDAB) online. As we can see, prescription medications occasionally pose a threat to our health. Surgery and pharmaceutical medications are examples of drastic methods that aren't always the solution. Our strategy when working with a new patient is to determine the precise source of their issue rather than just treating their symptoms. We create a treatment strategy that is suited to their particular requirements. Our approach includes a variety of non-invasive techniques and solutions, including chiropractic adjustments, non-surgical orthopedics, osteopathic medicine, physical therapy, and rehabilitation exercises. We believe that treating the underlying issue, rather than just the symptoms, is the key to achieving long-term wellness. Our state-of-the-art facility is staffed by experienced and compassionate chiropractors and doctors who are dedicated to helping patients achieve optimal health and wellness. We understand that every patient is unique and requires an individualized treatment plan, which is why we take the time to get to know each patient and their medical history before creating a personalized approach to their care. Our chiropractors are highly skilled and use the latest techniques to ensure that our patients receive the best possible care. Whether you're suffering from back pain, headaches, or any other type of discomfort, we can help. "The doctor of the future will give no medicine but will interest his patients in the care of the human frame, in diet, and in the cause and prevention of disease" - Thomas Edison Chiropractic Medicine Chiropractic medicine is a holistic approach to healthcare that focuses on the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of musculoskeletal disorders, particularly those affecting the spine. Chiropractors employ hands-on techniques and non-invasive therapies to address a wide range of conditions, including back pain, neck pain, headaches, and joint issues. One of the main benefits of chiropractic medicine is its natural and drug-free approach. Chiropractors aim to restore proper alignment and function of the body, promoting the body's innate ability to heal itself. By addressing the root causes of pain and dysfunction, chiropractic care can provide long-term relief and improved overall wellness. The process typically begins with a comprehensive assessment, including a thorough examination and medical history review. Chiropractors use this information to develop a personalized treatment plan, which may involve spinal adjustments, mobilization techniques, stretching exercises, and lifestyle advice. Treatment sessions are usually gentle and tailored to the individual's needs, with the goal of reducing pain, improving range of motion, and enhancing overall function. Results of chiropractic care can vary depending on the condition being treated and the individual's response to treatment. Some people experience immediate relief after their first session, while others may require multiple visits for sustained improvement. Regular chiropractic care may also help prevent future injuries and promote overall wellness. In terms of downtime, chiropractic care generally has minimal to no downtime. After a session, some individuals may experience mild soreness or stiffness, which usually subsides within a day or two. It is common for chiropractors to provide aftercare instructions, including recommendations for rest, hydration, and specific exercises to enhance the healing process. Overall, chiropractic medicine offers a non-invasive and holistic approach to healthcare, addressing musculoskeletal issues, promoting natural healing, and improving overall well-being. Benefits of Chiropractic Medicine: Pain relief Improved range of motion Stress reduction Enhanced athletic performance Improved sleep quality Boosted immune system Reduced reliance on medication Increased energy levels Improved posture Better overall health Improved nervous system function Conditions Chiropractic Medicine Treats: Sprains & Strains Fractures or Broken Bones Back & Neck Injuries Head Injuries & Concussions Spinal Cord Injuries Traumatic Brain Injuries Soft Tissue Injuries Whiplash Joint Dislocations Ligament & Tendon Injuries Shoulder Injuries Hip Injuries Knee Injuries Ankle Injuries Foot Injuries Nerve Damage Limited Range of Motion And More... When it comes to providing you with the most advanced chiropractic medicine solutions offered in modern day patient care, you can trust that Premier has your back and health in safe hands. To learn more about Chiropractic Medicine [click here](https://www.healthline.com/health/chiropractic-benefits) Non-Surgical Orthopedics Non-surgical orthopedics refers to a branch of medicine that focuses on the diagnosis, treatment, and management of musculoskeletal conditions without the need for surgical intervention. It encompasses a wide range of non-invasive and conservative treatment options for orthopedic injuries and disorders. The benefits of non-surgical orthopedics are numerous. Firstly, it offers a conservative approach, avoiding the risks and potential complications associated with surgery. Non-surgical treatments aim to reduce pain, improve function, and promote healing through methods such as physical therapy, medication, injections, bracing, and regenerative therapies. These techniques are often less invasive, have shorter recovery times, and allow individuals to maintain their daily activities more easily. The process of non-surgical orthopedics begins with a comprehensive evaluation by a healthcare professional specializing in orthopedics. They will assess the condition, conduct diagnostic tests if necessary, and develop an individualized treatment plan tailored to the patient's needs. This plan may involve a combination of therapies, such as physical therapy exercises to strengthen muscles and improve mobility, medications for pain management, or injections to reduce inflammation and promote healing. Results of non-surgical orthopedic treatments vary depending on the specific condition and the individual's response to treatment. In many cases, non-surgical interventions can provide significant pain relief, improved mobility, and functional recovery. It is important to note that some conditions may require ongoing or periodic treatments to manage symptoms effectively and maintain optimal function. In terms of downtime, non-surgical orthopedics generally involves minimal to no downtime. While some treatments may require rest or limitations on certain activities during the recovery period, they typically allow individuals to resume their daily routines relatively quickly. The healthcare professional overseeing the treatment will provide specific instructions regarding post-treatment care, including any necessary modifications to activities or rehabilitation exercises. In summary, non-surgical orthopedics offers a conservative approach to the diagnosis, treatment, and management of musculoskeletal conditions. It provides numerous benefits, such as avoiding surgical risks, reducing pain, improving function, and promoting healing. By tailoring treatment plans to individual needs, non-surgical orthopedics can effectively address a wide range of orthopedic conditions, allowing patients to recover and regain their quality of life. Benefits of Non-Surgical Orthopedics: Non-invasive treatment for musculoskeletal conditions Reduces pain and improves mobility using therapy or injections Lower risk and faster recovery compared to surgery More cost-effective Ideal for those with underlying health conditions or higher surgery risks Conditions Non-Surgical Orthopedics Treats: Sprains & Strains Fractures or Broken Bones Back & Neck Injuries Head Injuries & Concussions Spinal Cord Injuries Traumatic Brain Injuries Soft Tissue Injuries Whiplash Joint Dislocations Ligament & Tendon Injuries Shoulder Injuries Hip Injuries Knee Injuries Ankle Injuries Foot Injuries Nerve Damage Limited Range of Motion And More... To learn more about Non-Surgical Orthopedics [click here](https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/what-is-orthopedics) Sports Medicine Sports medicine is a specialized branch of medicine that focuses on the prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of injuries and conditions related to sports and physical activity. It encompasses a multidisciplinary approach, involving medical professionals, athletic trainers, physical therapists, and other healthcare providers working collaboratively to optimize athletic performance and promote overall well-being. The benefits of sports medicine are extensive. It not only addresses acute injuries sustained during sports activities but also focuses on injury prevention, performance enhancement, and the management of chronic conditions related to physical activity. Sports medicine professionals utilize a range of interventions, including injury assessment and diagnosis, rehabilitation exercises, therapeutic modalities, injury prevention strategies, and nutritional guidance. By addressing these aspects comprehensively, sports medicine aims to help athletes recover faster, improve their performance, and reduce the risk of future injuries. The process of sports medicine typically involves a comprehensive evaluation to assess the athlete's medical history, physical condition, and specific athletic goals. This evaluation may include physical examinations, imaging studies, and functional assessments. Based on this information, an individualized treatment plan is developed, which may include a combination of therapies such as physical therapy, bracing, medication, regenerative therapies, and surgical interventions if necessary. Results of sports medicine interventions can vary depending on the nature and severity of the injury or condition. Sports medicine aims to expedite the healing process, restore function, and minimize the risk of re-injury. With proper treatment and rehabilitation, athletes can often achieve full recovery, regain their athletic performance, and return to their chosen activities. In terms of downtime, the duration varies depending on the specific injury or condition and the recommended treatment plan. Some injuries may require a period of rest or modified activity to facilitate healing, while others may involve ongoing rehabilitation and gradual return to sports. The sports medicine team will provide guidance on the expected downtime and any necessary modifications to training or activities during the recovery phase. In summary, sports medicine is a specialized field that focuses on the prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of sports-related injuries and conditions. It offers numerous benefits, including faster recovery, improved performance, injury prevention, and overall well-being. By employing a multidisciplinary approach and individualized treatment plans, sports medicine aims to optimize athletes' health, function, and athletic potential. Benefits of Sports Medicine: Prevent and treat athletic injuries Personalized training and nutrition plans for athletes Management of chronic health conditions affecting athletic performance Address mental health concerns impacting athletes Provide guidance on injury prevention, management, and safe return to play protocols. Conditions Sports Medicine Treats: Sprains & Strains Fractures or Broken Bones Back & Neck Injuries Head Injuries & Concussions Spinal Cord Injuries Traumatic Brain Injuries Soft Tissue Injuries Whiplash Joint Dislocations Ligament & Tendon Injuries Shoulder Injuries Hip Injuries Knee Injuries Ankle Injuries Foot Injuries Nerve Damage Limited Range of Motion And More... To learn more about Sports Medicine [click here](https://lupinepublishers.com/orthopedics-sportsmedicine-journal/fulltext/the-benefits-of-sports-medicine.ID.000113.php) Medical Injections Premier offers a variety of medical injections to treat ailments and injuries. Medical injections are an effective way to deliver medication or therapeutic substances directly to a specific site in the body. They can provide numerous benefits to your health, including pain relief, inflammation reduction, tissue repair, and more. Overall, medical injections can provide numerous benefits to your health by delivering medication or therapeutic substances directly to a specific site in the body. Whether you are experiencing pain, inflammation, or tissue damage, medical injections can provide effective relief and help promote healing. Pain Injections Pain injections are a type of medical injection that can be used to alleviate pain and discomfort caused by various conditions. They typically contain local anesthetics or corticosteroids, which block pain signals and reduce inflammation. Pain injections are commonly used to treat back pain, neck pain, and joint pain. Pain Injections Benefits: Provide quick relief from acute and chronic pain Offer a non-surgical alternative to managing pain Treat a wide range of conditions, from arthritis to nerve damage Target specific areas of pain, allowing for more effective treatment Performed in an outpatient setting with minimal downtime Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) Injections PRP injections are another type of medical injection that have gained popularity in recent years. These injections involve drawing a patient's blood, separating the platelets, and injecting the concentrated platelets back into the patient's body to promote healing and reduce inflammation, in addition to hair regeneration. PRP injections have been used to treat a variety of conditions, including arthritis, tendonitis, sports injuries, and hair regeneration PRP Injections Benefits: Promotes tissue repair and healing Reduces inflammation and pain May delay or eliminate the need for surgery Minimal side effects and downtime Can be used to treat a variety of conditions, including arthritis, tendonitis, hairloss, and sports injuries. Joint injections or Aspirations (taking fluid out of a joint) Both offered at Premier. Either joint fluid can be obtained (aspirated) and used for appropriate laboratory testing to diagnose or medications can be injected into the joint space for pain relief. Commonly injected joints include the knee, shoulder, ankle, elbow, wrist, base of the thumb and small joints of the hands and feet. Joint injections can be used to treat a variety of conditions, including osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and gout. Joint Injections or Aspirations Benefits: Alleviate pain and inflammation in affected joints Improve mobility and range of motion Provide faster relief than oral medications Used to diagnose and treat joint conditions Low-risk alternative to joint replacement surgery Trigger Point Injections Trigger point injections are a type of medical injection that can be used to treat muscle pain and tension. They involve injecting medication directly into trigger points, which are tight, painful knots in muscles. Trigger point injections can be used to treat conditions such as fibromyalgia, myofascial pain syndrome, and tension headaches. Trigger Point Injections Benefits: Effectively treat muscle pain and spasms Improve range of motion and flexibility Provide immediate relief from trigger point pain Used in conjunction with physical therapy to optimize results Performed quickly and easily in an outpatient setting To learn more about Medical Injections [click here](https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/joint-injections) DOT Exams At our certified DOT exam facility, we understand that time is valuable for transportation professionals. That's why we offer quick and easy DOT exams administered by our highly qualified physicians. Our DOT physicals are not only mandatory but also highly regulated to ensure drivers' safety on the road. These exams are designed to detect physical, mental, and emotional issues that could affect a driver's ability to operate a commercial vehicle safely. Our dedicated team is equipped with the latest technology and techniques to conduct comprehensive exams that meet all DOT requirements. With our hassle-free and efficient approach, you can rest assured that you'll be back on the road in no time. Benefits of Premier DOT Exams: DOT Exam Certified facility Quick and easy exam experiences with onsite physicians Comprehensive exams detecting physical, mental, and emotional issues Latest technology and techniques for thorough exams meeting DOT requirements Efficient and hassle-free approach for quick return to the road Physical Exams A physical exam is a comprehensive evaluation of an individual's overall health, performed by a healthcare professional. It involves a systematic assessment of various body systems to gather information about a person's current health status, identify potential health issues, and establish a baseline for future reference. Physical exams serve as a crucial tool for early detection, prevention, and management of diseases. The benefits of physical exams are manifold. They allow healthcare providers to establish a personal connection with patients, evaluate their general well-being, and identify any potential risk factors or abnormalities. Physical exams can help detect early signs of illness or disease, allowing for prompt intervention and treatment. They also provide an opportunity to discuss health concerns, educate patients about healthy lifestyle choices, and address any questions or concerns individuals may have. The process of a physical exam typically involves several components. This may include measuring vital signs such as blood pressure, heart rate, and temperature. The healthcare provider may also perform a head-to-toe examination, checking various body systems, including the heart, lungs, abdomen, skin, and musculoskeletal system. Additionally, the provider may conduct specific screenings and tests based on the individual's age, gender, and medical history, such as blood tests, imaging studies, or cancer screenings. Results of a physical exam can vary depending on the findings and specific tests conducted. The healthcare provider will discuss the results with the individual, addressing any concerns or abnormalities that were identified. Depending on the findings, further diagnostic tests or follow-up appointments may be recommended to investigate potential issues or monitor ongoing health conditions. Benefits of Premier Physical Exams: Comprehensive physical exams to detect potential health issues before they become serious problems. Experienced team of physicians providing personalized plans for optimal health and wellness. Convenient scheduling options to fit your busy life. State-of-the-art technology and techniques used for accurate and thorough exams. Peace of mind knowing that you're taking charge of your health and well-being with Premier. To learn more about the importance of Physical Exams [click here](https://www.healthline.com/health/physical-examination) Digital X-Ray Services At Premier, we understand that injuries can happen at any time, and we believe that timely and accurate diagnosis is essential to effective treatment and rehabilitation. That's why we offer onsite digital X-ray services to our patients. Our state-of-the-art X-ray machine allows us to quickly and accurately diagnose your condition, without the need for inconvenient and time-consuming referrals to offsite facilities. With our immediate report and diagnoses, we can provide you with faster and more effective rehabilitation, allowing you to get back to your daily routine as quickly as possible. Benefits of Premier Digital X-Ray Services: Onsite digital X-ray services for quick and accurate diagnosis. No need for inconvenient referrals to offsite facilities. Immediate report and diagnoses for faster and more effective rehabilitation. State-of-the-art technology and techniques for accurate and thorough X-rays.
